macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Major Stock Market Divergence: Dow Up 1.5%, Nasdaq 100 Down Over 3%
items.summary: The Dow Jones index gained nearly 1.5% while the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 declined over 3%, reflecting a significant divergence between blue-chip value stocks and growth stocks. The S&P 500 is slightly negative year-to-date, down around 1.5%.

items.title: AI Disruption Concerns Drive Tech Volatility; Cisco Drops 12%
items.summary: Technology stocks experienced significant volatility driven by AI-disruption fears, with Cisco dropping 12% on margin pressure and the Nasdaq recording its fifth decline of more than 1% in ten days. Software ETFs fell 2% as investors reassess AI's impact across sectors.

items.title: January CPI Report Released; Core Inflation Expected to Decelerate to 2.5%
items.summary: The January CPI data was released as a major market catalyst, with consensus expectations pointing to core inflation decelerating to 2.5% year-on-year from 2.7% previously. Treasury yields fell ahead of the report, with the 10-year dropping to about 4.1%.

items.title: Fed Rate Cut Expectations Shift: July Cut Fully Priced In, March Cut Unlikely
items.summary: Markets currently see little chance of a March rate cut, but a July rate cut is fully priced in. The softer inflation data supports the case for mid-year rate cuts and may help stabilize yields and support growth stocks.

items.title: Emerging Markets Outperform; MSCI Index Up 11% Year-to-Date
items.summary: International markets continue to outperform US equities, with the MSCI Emerging Markets Index up more than 11% year-to-date, partially influenced by a softer US Dollar.

items.title: Oil Prices Fall on Trump's Iran Diplomatic Negotiations Emphasis
items.summary: Oil prices declined following President Trump's renewed emphasis on pursuing diplomatic negotiations with Iran, while gold and silver recorded modest losses.

items.title: S&P 500 Shows Technical Warning Signs; Head and Shoulders Pattern Emerging
items.summary: The S&P 500 has broken from an up-sloping trendline and is forming a potential Head and Shoulders bearish pattern, with a critical support level at 6,790. A daily close below this level could trigger a measured move lower.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Price Rises 1% to $68,882 Amid Bullish Breakout Signals
items.summary: Bitcoin has increased by 1% since yesterday, breaking local resistance at $67,155 and trading at $68,882. Analysts eye potential moves to $70,000-$75,000 if key levels hold, though midterm remains bearish below $76,600.

items.title: Bitcoin Reacts Positively to Cooler-Than-Expected CPI Report
items.summary: Bitcoin showed immediate positive reaction to a cooler-than-expected CPI report, testing resistance at $94,449 with potential breakout to $97,000 amid improving market sentiment and bullish divergence.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: OpenAI Retires GPT-4o Amid User Backlash and Shift to GPT-5.2
items.summary: OpenAI is retiring the widely used GPT-4o model on February 13, as most users have migrated to GPT-5.2, sparking complaints from thousands who credit it for life-saving support. This move highlights rapid model iteration in AI.

items.title: SpaceX Acquires xAI, Eyes Space-Based Data Centers
items.summary: Elon Musk's SpaceX has acquired xAI, boosting AI research funding and focusing on space applications, including potential solar-powered data centers in orbit.

items.title: Anthropic Releases Claude Opus 4.6, Tops Intelligence Index
items.summary: Anthropic updated its flagship Claude Opus 4.6 model, which now leads the Intelligence Index by reasoning better over complex problems.

items.title: MiniMax Launches Cost-Effective M2.5 Models Near State-of-the-Art
items.summary: Chinese startup MiniMax released M2.5 and M2.5 Lightning, open models claiming near-top performance at 1/20th the cost of rivals like Claude Opus 4.6.

items.title: Google Reports Surge in AI Model Extraction Attacks and Malware
items.summary: Google's Threat Intelligence and DeepMind noted rising model distillation attacks and AI-integrated malware like HONESTCUE using Gemini APIs, but no fundamental threat shifts yet.

items.title: AI Insiders Warn of Escalating Risks from Autonomous Models
items.summary: Researchers from OpenAI and Anthropic highlight existential risks, AI-enabled crime, and self-improving systems as models gain autonomy faster than governance.

items.title: US Tech Giants Plan $670B AI Data Center Investments in 2026
items.summary: Meta, Amazon, Microsoft, and Alphabet are set to invest $670 billion primarily in AI infrastructure, fueling the largest capital cycle in tech history.

items.title: Palantir Surges on AI Protocol Demand in Government and Commercial Sectors
items.summary: Palantir reported $608 million net income driven by its Artificial Intelligence Protocol (AIP), highlighting market rewards for proven AI execution.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: PlayStation State of Play February 2026 Reveals Major Announcements Including God of War Remakes and New Titles
items.summary: Sony's State of Play showcased God of War Greek trilogy remake in early development, God of War Sons of Sparta out now on PS5, Darwin’s Paradox releasing April 2 with demo tomorrow, Marathon Server Slam on Feb 26, Castlevania: Belmont's Curse for 2026, and Metal Gear Solid: Master Collection Vol. 2 on August 27.[1][2]

items.title: Rayman Definitive Edition Launches Today for 30th Anniversary
items.summary: Ubisoft released a definitive edition of the original Rayman game on February 13, 2026, featuring 120 additional levels and an exclusive documentary to celebrate the franchise's 30th anniversary.[2]

items.title: Two New Games Join Xbox Game Pass Today
items.summary: Xbox Game Pass added two new titles on February 13, 2026, including Kingdom Come: Deliverance with a free Series X|S upgrade.[4]

items.title: Mina the Hollower Demo Available Today Ahead of Spring 2026 Launch
items.summary: Indie title Mina the Hollower released a demo on February 13 ahead of its full spring 2026 release, highlighted during State of Play.[2]

items.title: Neva Prologue Prequel Chapter Arrives February 19
items.summary: A prequel chapter for Neva, titled Neva Prologue, is set to release on February 19, 2026, as announced in State of Play.[2]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Samsung Starts Shipping HBM4 Memory Samples
items.summary: Samsung has begun shipping HBM4 samples, intensifying competition in high-bandwidth memory critical for AI infrastructure and GPU performance. This positions Samsung ahead in the race to supply advanced memory chips to partners like Nvidia.

items.title: YouTube Launches on Apple Vision Pro
items.summary: YouTube has officially launched its app on Apple Vision Pro, bringing a major streaming service to the spatial computing headset and signaling growing ecosystem support.

items.title: Waymo Rolls Out New Robotaxis with Geely Vans
items.summary: Waymo is deploying a new fleet of robotaxis using Geely vans, replacing Jaguar SUVs to expand its autonomous ride-hailing service.

items.title: US and Taiwan Sign Trade Pact to Cut Tariffs
items.summary: The US and Taiwan have signed a trade agreement to reduce tariffs and boost investments, with the US setting a 15% tariff rate on Taiwan goods amid ongoing economic talks.

items.title: Samsung Claims Lead in Shipping AI Chips to Nvidia
items.summary: Samsung asserts its leadership in supplying AI chips to Nvidia, highlighting its strong position in the semiconductor supply chain for high-performance computing.

items.title: Kioxia Extends Top Stock Performance on AI Outlook
items.summary: Kioxia continues its world-leading stock performance, driven by strong demand outlook fueled by AI-related memory needs.

items.title: SoftBank Swings to Profit on OpenAI Valuation Boost
items.summary: SoftBank reported a profit turnaround, boosted by the rising valuation of its OpenAI investment, amid positive market sentiment.

items.title: Pinterest Earnings Fall Short Due to Tariffs
items.summary: Pinterest missed earnings expectations, citing an 'exogenous shock' from new tariffs impacting its business.
